citances.sentence:
On 31 July 2009, I refused EMAS leave to amend to add a wholly new claim that had arisen after T-D Joint Venture Pty Limited had ceased to be a relevant person following termination of its charter of the " APC Aussie 1 ": EMAS Offshore Pte Ltd v The Ship "Aussie 1" [2009] FCA 872 ; (2009) 258 ALR 454. APC paid $1,439,601.05 into Court in order to secure the release of the barge. At the same time, APC filed an application to Court for release of ship or other security under r 52(1) of the Admiralty Rules , being in form 19 prescribed under the Rules. In the form 19, APC was named as applicant and owner of the barge. The grounds on which the release was sought were described as:
"Payment of the amount claimed by the Plaintiff (including interest and costs) in the sum of $1,439.601.05 into Court as security for the plaintiff's claim in the proceedings. "
